title: J. H. Down
text:
J. H. Down (first name and dates of birth and death unknown) was an English <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a>er. Down was a left-handed <a href="Batsman%20%28cricket%29">batsman</a> who bowled <a href="slow%20left-arm%20orthodox">slow left-arm orthodox</a>.
Down made his first-class debut for <a href="Hampshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Hampshire</a> in the <a href="1914%20County%20Championship">1914 County Championship</a> against <a href="Sussex%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Sussex</a>, in which, batting at number eleven, he made his highest first-class score of 31<a href="not%20out">*</a>. Down played his final first-class match in the same season against <a href="Worcestershire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Worcestershire</a>, where he took his only first-class wicket.
With the onset of <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> first-class cricket was suspended until 1919, with Down not making any further first-class appearances after the war.
